result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Van was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders defendants extended supervision conditions be left to Agent's supervision, upon release.

copy to defendant, jail, prison and DOC

John Snider, DA present
Attorney Thomas Johnson present
Defendant present - in custody
Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form filed with the Court
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea to counts 2 and 3 in 14CF106 and count 1 in 14CM169
Per DA Snider - State has completed witness responsibility
Court orders as follows:
14Cf106 - count 2 - 2 years prison with 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision
Count 3 - defendant to serve 3 years prison with 18 months initial confident and 18 months extended supervision concurrent with count 2, with all other remaining counts dismissed and read-in
14CM169 - defendant to serve 2 years prison with 1 year initial confident followed by 1 year extended supervision concurrent with 14CF106 and concurrent with any other sentence now serving with all remaining counts dismissed and read-in 
Defendant given 148 days credit
Court orders extended supervision conditions left to agent supervision upon release
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights, ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment and notice of firearm restriction/possession
